column4: Hey, I'm trying to install ubuntu on my pc (amd 3200 64, i386 version) with a x800xl ati video card.  When the installer starts, the colors are all wrong and then the installer freezes when the bar finishes loading, graphical corruption occurs.
Tried the safe graphical mode, or specifying the resolution with the f4 key?
correct, same things basically, but when I change the resolution I usually get correct colors but a x crash after the loading bar.
Might be worth trying ctrl+alt+f1 and seeing if it gives you a text console
There also ALT+SYSREQ(printscr) and typing RSEIUB slowly and seeing if it recovers
no luck with either of those.  Is there any way to boot to the old text mode installer?
Otherwise you could try the server version, and install ubuntu-desktop
actually, when I changed my resolution to 640x480, it still crashed but I can get into the console now.  X is reporting an error
x window system couldn't be started, it now disabled itself
'sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg' and try pluging around with the modes
no luck messing with the values, I appreciate the help though!
You could try using the official binary drivers for your card, should be possible to install them on the livecd

finally got it working, it apparently is a pretty big bug that is unresolved.  I had to remove gli and dri from xorg.conf, and the live cd is now booting in some sort of vesa mode and installing.  Apparently fglrx would have fixed it as you suggested.  Thanks!
